levels.title: Quantitative Methods
levels.subtitle: Statistical tools and mathematical foundations for investment analysis
levels.description: Master statistical methods, probability, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and data science techniques used in investment analysis.

levels.title: Economics
levels.subtitle: Micro and macroeconomic theory applied to financial markets
levels.description: Understand market structures, business cycles, monetary and fiscal policy, international trade, and exchange rate mechanics.

levels.title: Financial Statement Analysis
levels.subtitle: Analyzing financial statements for investment decisions
levels.description: Develop expertise in analyzing income statements, balance sheets, cash flows, and financial ratios across accounting standards.

levels.title: Corporate Issuers
levels.subtitle: Corporate structure, governance, and capital allocation
levels.description: Analyze corporate governance, capital structure, working capital management, and business models for investment evaluation.

levels.title: Equity Investments
levels.subtitle: Equity markets, valuation, and security analysis
levels.description: Learn equity market structure, security analysis, industry analysis, and valuation techniques for equity investments.

levels.title: Fixed Income
levels.subtitle: Bond markets, valuation, and risk management
levels.description: Master bond valuation, yield analysis, duration and convexity, credit analysis, and structured products.

levels.title: Derivatives
levels.subtitle: Forwards, futures, options, and swaps
levels.description: Understand derivative instruments, pricing models, and their applications in hedging and speculation.

levels.title: Alternative Investments
levels.subtitle: Private equity, real estate, hedge funds, and more
levels.description: Explore private equity, real estate, hedge funds, commodities, and digital assets as portfolio diversifiers.

levels.title: Portfolio Management
levels.subtitle: Portfolio theory, construction, and risk management
levels.description: Apply portfolio theory, risk management, and behavioral finance to construct and manage investment portfolios.

levels.title: Ethical and Professional Standards
levels.subtitle: CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Practice
levels.description: Apply the CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct to investment scenarios.

levels.title: Mock Exams
levels.subtitle: Full-length practice exams simulating real test conditions
levels.description: Test your knowledge with full-length mock exams that simulate the actual CFA exam experience.

level-1.title: Quantitative Methods
level-1.description: Master statistical methods, probability, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and data science techniques used in investment analysis.

level-1.title: QM.1: Basics of Multiple Regression
level-1.description: Formulate and interpret multiple regression models. Test hypotheses about regression coefficients.

level-1.title: QM.2: Evaluating Regression Model Fit
level-1.description: Evaluate regression model fit using R-squared, adjusted R-squared, F-statistic, and interpret model results.

level-1.title: QM.3: Model Misspecification
level-1.description: Detect and correct heteroskedasticity, serial correlation, multicollinearity, and misspecified functional forms.

level-1.title: QM.4: Extensions of Multiple Regression
level-1.description: Apply qualitative variables, interaction terms, and logistic regression in financial modeling.

level-1.title: QM.5: Time-Series Analysis
level-1.description: Model and forecast time series using AR, MA, and ARMA models. Test for stationarity and cointegration.

level-1.title: QM.6: Machine Learning
level-1.description: Describe supervised and unsupervised learning techniques and their applications in investment analysis.

level-1.title: QM.7: Big Data Projects
level-1.description: Describe big data project steps, data quality issues, and the application of text analytics in finance.

level-1.title: QM: Quantitative Methods Practice Drill
level-1.description: 20 practice problems covering Level II Quantitative Methods.

level-1.title: Quantitative Methods Checkpoint
level-1.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Quantitative Methods topics.

level-2.title: Economics
level-2.description: Understand market structures, business cycles, monetary and fiscal policy, international trade, and exchange rate mechanics.

level-2.title: ECON.1: Currency Exchange Rates: Understanding Equilibrium Value
level-2.description: Apply parity conditions, arbitrage, and balance of payments analysis to currency valuation and forecasting.

level-2.title: ECON.2: Economic Growth
level-2.description: Describe theories of economic growth and their implications for investment decision-making.

level-2.title: ECON: Economics Practice Drill
level-2.description: 15 practice problems covering Level II Economics.

level-2.title: Economics Checkpoint
level-2.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Economics topics.

level-3.title: Financial Statement Analysis
level-3.description: Develop expertise in analyzing income statements, balance sheets, cash flows, and financial ratios across accounting standards.

level-3.title: FSA.1: Intercorporate Investments
level-3.description: Analyze equity method, acquisition method, and consolidation accounting for intercorporate investments.

level-3.title: FSA.2: Employee Compensation: Post-Employment and Share-Based
level-3.description: Analyze pension accounting (defined benefit and defined contribution) and share-based compensation effects.

level-3.title: FSA.3: Multinational Operations
level-3.description: Analyze the effects of foreign currency translation methods on financial statements and ratios.

level-3.title: FSA.4: Analysis of Financial Institutions
level-3.description: Analyze financial statements of banks and insurance companies. Evaluate CAMELS-type metrics.

level-3.title: FSA.5: Evaluating the Quality of Financial Reports
level-3.description: Evaluate financial reporting quality and earnings quality. Identify potential manipulation indicators.

level-3.title: FSA.6: Integration of Financial Statement Analysis Techniques
level-3.description: Integrate financial statement analysis tools for comprehensive company evaluation and forecasting.

level-3.title: FSA: Financial Statement Analysis Practice Drill
level-3.description: 25 practice problems covering Level II Financial Statement Analysis.

level-3.title: Financial Statement Analysis Checkpoint
level-3.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Financial Statement Analysis topics.

level-4.title: Corporate Issuers
level-4.description: Analyze corporate governance, capital structure, working capital management, and business models for investment evaluation.

level-4.title: CI.1: Analysis of Dividends and Share Repurchases
level-4.description: Analyze dividend policies, share repurchase methods, and their effects on shareholder value.

level-4.title: CI.2: Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) Considerations
level-4.description: Integrate ESG factors into investment analysis. Evaluate ESG reporting frameworks and materiality.

level-4.title: CI.3: Mergers and Acquisitions
level-4.description: Analyze merger motivations, valuation methods, defense mechanisms, and post-merger performance.

level-4.title: CI.4: Corporate Restructuring
level-4.description: Analyze divestitures, spin-offs, equity carve-outs, and their effects on shareholder value.

level-4.title: CORP: Corporate Issuers Practice Drill
level-4.description: 20 practice problems covering Level II Corporate Issuers.

level-4.title: Corporate Issuers Checkpoint
level-4.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Corporate Issuers topics.

level-5.title: Equity Investments
level-5.description: Learn equity market structure, security analysis, industry analysis, and valuation techniques for equity investments.

level-5.title: EQ.1: Equity Valuation: Applications and Processes
level-5.description: Define intrinsic value, select appropriate valuation models, and describe the equity valuation process.

level-5.title: EQ.2: Discounted Dividend Valuation
level-5.description: Apply Gordon growth, two-stage, and H-models to value equity. Estimate sustainable growth rates.

level-5.title: EQ.3: Free Cash Flow Valuation
level-5.description: Calculate FCFF and FCFE. Apply single-stage and multi-stage FCF models to value equity.

level-5.title: EQ.4: Market-Based Valuation: Price and Enterprise Value Multiples
level-5.description: Calculate and interpret P/E, P/B, P/S, P/CF, and EV multiples for equity valuation.

level-5.title: EQ.5: Residual Income Valuation
level-5.description: Calculate and interpret residual income. Apply the residual income model to value equity.

level-5.title: EQ.6: Private Company Valuation
level-5.description: Describe challenges of private company valuation. Apply income, market, and asset-based approaches.

level-5.title: EQ: Equity Investments Practice Drill
level-5.description: 25 practice problems covering Level II Equity Investments.

level-5.title: Equity Investments Checkpoint
level-5.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Equity Investments topics.

level-6.title: Fixed Income
level-6.description: Master bond valuation, yield analysis, duration and convexity, credit analysis, and structured products.

level-6.title: FI.1: The Term Structure and Interest Rate Dynamics
level-6.description: Describe spot rate curve, forward rate model, and theories of term structure. Apply swap rate curve.

level-6.title: FI.2: The Arbitrage-Free Valuation Framework
level-6.description: Value bonds using binomial interest rate trees and Monte Carlo simulation. Apply arbitrage-free pricing.

level-6.title: FI.3: Valuation and Analysis of Bonds with Embedded Options
level-6.description: Analyze callable, putable, and convertible bonds using option-adjusted spreads and interest rate trees.

level-6.title: FI.4: Credit Analysis Models
level-6.description: Apply structural and reduced-form credit models. Analyze credit term structures and default probabilities.

level-6.title: FI.5: Credit Default Swaps
level-6.description: Describe CDS features, pricing, and applications for hedging and trading credit risk.

level-6.title: FI: Fixed Income Practice Drill
level-6.description: 25 practice problems covering Level II Fixed Income.

level-6.title: Fixed Income Checkpoint
level-6.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Fixed Income topics.

level-7.title: Derivatives
level-7.description: Understand derivative instruments, pricing models, and their applications in hedging and speculation.

level-7.title: DER.1: Pricing and Valuation of Forward Commitments
level-7.description: Price and value forwards, futures, and swaps on equities, fixed income, and currencies.

level-7.title: DER.2: Valuation of Contingent Claims
level-7.description: Value options using binomial and Black-Scholes-Merton models. Analyze option Greeks.

level-7.title: DERIV: Derivatives Practice Drill
level-7.description: 20 practice problems covering Level II Derivatives.

level-7.title: Derivatives Checkpoint
level-7.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Derivatives topics.

level-8.title: Alternative Investments
level-8.description: Explore private equity, real estate, hedge funds, commodities, and digital assets as portfolio diversifiers.

level-8.title: ALT.1: Investments in Private Capital
level-8.description: Analyze private equity and private debt investment strategies, structures, and performance metrics.

level-8.title: ALT.2: Overview of Types of Real Estate Investment
level-8.description: Describe real estate investment forms, valuation methods, and market analysis frameworks.

level-8.title: ALT.3: Natural Resources
level-8.description: Analyze commodity markets, farmland, timberland investments, and their portfolio diversification roles.

level-8.title: ALT.4: Hedge Fund Strategies
level-8.description: Analyze equity, event-driven, relative value, and macro hedge fund strategies and their risk profiles.

level-8.title: ALT: Alternative Investments Practice Drill
level-8.description: 15 practice problems covering Level II Alternative Investments.

level-8.title: Alternative Investments Checkpoint
level-8.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Alternative Investments topics.

level-9.title: Portfolio Management
level-9.description: Apply portfolio theory, risk management, and behavioral finance to construct and manage investment portfolios.

level-9.title: PM.1: Economics and Investment Markets
level-9.description: Analyze the relationships between economic variables and investment market returns.

level-9.title: PM.2: Analysis of Active Portfolio Management
level-9.description: Evaluate active portfolio management using the fundamental law and information ratio.

level-9.title: PM.3: Using Multifactor Models
level-9.description: Apply multifactor models including Fama-French and APT for risk analysis and portfolio construction.

level-9.title: PM.4: Portfolio Construction
level-9.description: Describe portfolio construction techniques, security selection, and portfolio optimization methods.

level-9.title: PM.5: Measuring and Managing Market Risk
level-9.description: Calculate and interpret VaR, conditional VaR, and stress testing for risk management.

level-9.title: PM.6: Backtesting and Simulation
level-9.description: Apply backtesting and simulation methods to evaluate investment strategies and risk models.

level-9.title: PM: Portfolio Management Practice Drill
level-9.description: 20 practice problems covering Level II Portfolio Management.

level-9.title: Portfolio Management Checkpoint
level-9.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Portfolio Management topics.

level-10.title: Ethical and Professional Standards
level-10.description: Apply the CFA Institute Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct to investment scenarios.

level-10.title: ETH.1: Code of Ethics and Standards of Professional Conduct
level-10.description: Apply the CFA Institute Code and Standards to complex Level II scenarios.

level-10.title: ETH.2: Guidance for Standards I-VII
level-10.description: Apply detailed guidance for each Standard of Professional Conduct to advanced ethical scenarios.

level-10.title: ETH.3: Application of the Code and Standards: Level II
level-10.description: Analyze complex ethical case studies using the Code and Standards framework at the Level II depth.

level-10.title: ETHICS: Ethical and Professional Standards Practice Drill
level-10.description: 20 practice problems covering Level II Ethical and Professional Standards.

level-10.title: Ethics Checkpoint
level-10.description: Test your understanding across all Level II Ethics topics.

level-11.title: Mock Exams
level-11.description: Test your knowledge with full-length mock exams that simulate the actual CFA exam experience.

level-11.title: CFA Level II Mock Exam - Session 1 (Morning)
level-11.description: Full-length mock exam with 11 vignette-based item sets, 44 questions total. Covers all Level II topics with realistic case studies.

level-11.title: CFA Level II Mock Exam - Session 2 (Afternoon)
level-11.description: Full-length mock exam with 11 vignette-based item sets, 44 questions total. Covers all Level II topics with realistic case studies.
